video.title: First Aid for Burns and Scalds

steps.title: Ensure Safety
steps.description: Remove the person from the source of heat or danger. Make sure the area is safe before approaching.

steps.title: Cool the Burn
steps.description: Immediately run cool (not cold) water over the burn for 10â€“20 minutes. Do not use ice, as it can damage the skin further.

steps.title: Protect the Burn
steps.description: Cover the burn with a clean, non-stick cloth or sterile dressing. Avoid using creams, oils, or adhesive bandages on severe burns.

steps.title: Relieve Pain
steps.description: If appropriate, give over-the-counter pain relief (e.g., paracetamol or ibuprofen). Keep the victim calm and comfortable.

steps.title: Seek Medical Help
steps.description: Call for professional help if the burn is large or deep, on the face, hands, feet, or genitals, or caused by chemicals, electricity, or fire.
